The `spawnMouseRotateTask` method is essential for enabling mouse-driven rotation in both top-down and bottom-up perspectives within a 3D scene. It calculates the intersection point of the mouse click with the 3D space, adjusting based on the camera's position to determine the correct center for rotation. This functionality integrates with other methods to provide smooth user interaction when manipulating objects or scenes using mouse controls.

def spawnMouseRotateTask(self):
        # Kill any existing tasks
        self.__stopManipulateCamera()
        direct = ShowBaseGlobal.direct
        if self.perspCollPlane:
            iRay = SelectionRay(direct.camera)
            iRay.collider.setFromLens(direct.camNode, 0.0, 0.0)
            iRay.collideWithBitMask(1)

            if direct.camera.getPos().getZ() >=0:
                iRay.ct.traverse(self.perspCollPlane)
            else:
                iRay.ct.traverse(self.perspCollPlane2)

            if iRay.getNumEntries() > 0:
                entry = iRay.getEntry(0)
                hitPt = entry.getSurfacePoint(entry.getFromNodePath())

                # create a temp nodePath to get the position
                np = NodePath('temp')
                np.setPos(direct.camera, hitPt)
                self.coaMarkerPos = np.getPos()
                np.removeNode()
                self.coaMarker.setPos(self.coaMarkerPos)
